channel.title: CyberNetSec - Supply Chain Attack
channel.description: Latest supply chain attack threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Ingram Micro Breach Exposes Data of 42,000 After Safepay Ransomware Attack
item.description:
Global IT distributor Ingram Micro has officially notified 42,521 individuals that their personal and sensitive information, including Social Security numbers, was stolen during a ransomware attack in July 2025. The incident, attributed to the Safepay ransomware group, compromised employment and job...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Evelyn Stealer: New Malware Hits Developers Through Malicious VS Code Extensions
item.description:
A new information-stealing malware, named Evelyn Stealer, is being distributed through malicious extensions on the Microsoft Visual Studio Code (VS Code) Marketplace. Researchers at Trend Micro and Koi Security report the campaign specifically targets software developers to steal credentials, crypto...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Actor

item.title: 2025 in Review: Simple Errors, Not 0-Days, Caused Biggest Breaches
item.description:
A year-end analysis of 2025's major data breaches reveals a recurring theme: fundamental security failures, not sophisticated zero-day exploits, were the primary cause. The report, published on December 26, 2025, highlights cloud security misconfigurations and third-party supply chain attacks as the...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Cloud Security

item.title: SpyCloud Unveils Supply Chain Threat Protection to Combat Third-Party Identity Risks
item.description:
SpyCloud has launched its Supply Chain Threat Protection solution, a new platform designed to give organizations visibility into identity-related compromises within their vendor and supplier ecosystems. By leveraging a massive repository of recaptured data from breaches and malware infections, the s...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Threat Intelligence, Security Operations

item.title: AWS Patches 'CodeBreach' Flaw, Averting Massive GitHub Supply Chain Attack
item.description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) has remediated a critical vulnerability in its AWS CodeBuild service, dubbed 'CodeBreach' by Wiz researchers. The flaw, which stemmed from a misconfigured webhook filter, could have allowed unauthenticated attackers to inject malicious code into the build processes of major...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Cloud Security, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: GlassWorm Malware Pivots to Attack macOS Developers via Malicious VS Code Extensions
item.description:
The GlassWorm malware campaign has evolved, now specifically targeting macOS developers through malicious extensions for Visual Studio Code and OpenVSX. This new wave of attacks, detailed in a security digest from Acronis, uses a self-propagating worm to deliver its payload. The malware embeds an en...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Supply Chain Attack, Mobile Security

item.title: Pax8 Data Leak Exposes Sensitive MSP and Customer Info via Accidental Email
item.description:
Cloud commerce marketplace Pax8 has confirmed a data exposure incident caused by human error. On January 13, an employee mistakenly sent an email containing a CSV file with sensitive, non-PII business data for approximately 1,800 Managed Service Provider (MSP) partners. The email, sent to fewer than...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: ConnectPOS Exposed Admin GitHub Token for Over Four Years, Creating Massive Supply Chain Risk
item.description:
Point-of-sale vendor ConnectPOS exposed a GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT) with full administrative privileges in its public documentation for over four years, from September 2021 until its discovery in January 2026. The blunder, found by security firm Sansec, put the vendor's entire software supp...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Vulnerability, Data Breach

item.title: French Immigration Agency Data Leaked via Third-Party Breach
item.description:
France's Office for Immigration and Integration (OFII) has confirmed a data breach originating from a compromised third-party service provider. In early January 2026, a hacker claimed to be selling a database of up to 2.1 million records of foreign residents on BreachForums, posting samples that inc...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Regulatory

item.title: Supply Chain Attack: Malicious npm Packages Steal Credentials from n8n Automation Platform
item.description:
A novel supply chain attack discovered by Endor Labs is targeting users of the n8n workflow automation platform. Attackers are publishing malicious packages to the npm registry, disguised as legitimate 'community nodes' for popular services. When an unsuspecting user installs one of these nodes and ...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Cloud Security
